strings.Value: "Let me dress it. We don't want it getting worse."
"I don't want to see this ever again!"
[Lean over his wrist and lick off the blood]
"Reg, I'm worried about you. What's going on?"
{n}You notice a row of fresh cuts across Regongar's wrist that have barely started to heal.{/n}
"What's the difference?!" {n}You hear anger in the half-orc's voice.{/n} "It's just a cut! Like you care! Like anyone cares!"

{n}The half-orc waves you away with pretentious indifference.{/n} "Don't pay any attention. Just some stupid thoughts in my head. I'm fine â€” it's definitely no worse than the mess me and her got out of before!"
{n}The half-orc turns to stone for a moment and then pulls you close.{/n}
"Fine, fine! You won't. Don't make a tragedy out of it, just forget it! They're just scratches, I'm telling you."
"Don't worry, I'm not killing myself! I'll drink a potion, and it'll heal. Don't worry. I'm fine, ha hmm..." {n}Regongar stops for a moment, biting his lip.{/n}

{n}The half-orc's voice grows soft and hoarse.{/n} "I said a stupid thing, and I'm sorry. Of course you care. It's just that I... Well, I sat up at night, couldn't sleep, and then I started thinking... About you, about Octavia. About the stupid things I've done, especially to her. Not on purpose, you know? I love both of you! But does she still love me? After everything I've done? I'm not so sure any more. And you? And I felt so bad about everything... So I just... It's just to perk me up. Don't pay any attention, they're just scratches. Let's not talk about it, all right?"
